items.text: Text has sufficient contrast (≥ 4.5:1 for normal text, ≥ 3:1 for large text)
Text can be resized up to 200% without loss of content or functionality
Color is not the only way information is conveyed (e.g. not just red = error)
Focus indicators (e.g. outlines when tabbing) are clearly visible
All functionality is accessible using a keyboard
Tabbing order is logical and follows the visual layout
All form fields have visible labels or accessible names (e.g. `label`, `aria-label`)
Error messages are clear and describe what went wrong
No horizontal scrolling is required on small screens
Layout and content still make sense without color, images, or animations
Content is structured with semantic HTML (`h1`, `nav`, `main`, `button`, etc.)
All interactive elements have accessible names (`aria-label` or visible text)
Links and buttons clearly describe their purpose (never just 'Click here')
`role` is only used when semantic HTML is not sufficient
